page.title: 03Education
page.content: Studham Voluntary Controlled Lower School was built in 1959 and extended in 1969. The school is next to the original building now a private residence. Heating is by oil and electricity as there is no gas in the village. Facilities include an open air swimming pool(unheated), climbing frame(erected over a safety surface), playground,greenhouse,2 aviaries,and an animal shelter. A pond provides scope for environmental work. The school serves Studham and Whipsnade villages but accepts children from further afield if there are places available and their parents can transport them.The majority of children travel to school by coach, some by car and a few walk. Children may start school as rising 5's and leave for Middle School at 9+.
